gov.nih.nlm.ling.graph

Class DocumentGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractGraph<V,E>
      • org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractBaseGraph<V,E>
        • org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleDirectedGraph<V,E>
          • org.jgrapht.experimental.dag.DirectedAcyclicGraph<Node,Edge>
            • gov.nih.nlm.ling.graph.DocumentGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, org.jgrapht.DirectedGraph<Node,Edge>, org.jgrapht.Graph<Node,Edge>

    public class DocumentGraph
extends org.jgrapht.experimental.dag.DirectedAcyclicGraph<Node,Edge>
    Represents a Document content as a directed graph where the nodes are SurfaceElement objects and the edges between the nodes are SynDependency objects. The top-level sentence content is captured with DummyNode objects and the adjacency of sentences is captured with DummyEdge objects between these nodes.

    This class is used to provide the basis for bottom-up semantic composition.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DocumentGraph

        public DocumentGraph(Document doc)
        Instantiates a DocumentGraph object from the contents of a Document. Nodes corresponding to sentences are prefixed with 'TOP' and the edges linking adjacent sentences are prefixed with 'PREV'.
        Parameters:
        doc - the corresponding document
